content:
Art. 4.28. 
Split
Where the deceased leaves neither descendants nor close relatives, the succession is, by the effect of the split, divided into two equal shares: one for the relatives in the paternal line, the other for the relatives in the maternal line. It devolves, in each of these lines, according to the rules set out in this chapter.
Once this first division has been made between the paternal and maternal lines, there is no further division between the various branches.
In the absence of parents in the degree of succession in one line, the parents of the other line succeed for the whole.
